description: Variation of condition 2 (approved drawings), condition 5 (refuse storage), condition 8 (lifetime homes), condition 14 (CO2 emissions) and condition 15 (photovoltaic panels) of planning permission ref: P/2014/4792 dated 06/01/2016 for redevelopment of the site to provide a part two and three-storey building fronting Uxbridge Road containing 4 x 2 bed and 2x 1 bed flats and a two storey building fronting Shirley Gardens containing 4 x 1 bed flat (10 private market units in total), refuse storage, cycle storage, amenity space and the provision of 6 car parking spaces (1 disabled) on the frontage with access off Shirley Gardens (following the demolition of existing building on the site) (Resubmission of application PP/2010/5088)
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin no later than three years from the date of P/2014/4792 dated 06/01/2016.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): A2D/938.X01_Rev.A, 938-SK10, 938-SK11, 938-SK12, 938-SK13, 938-SK14, 938-SK15, 938-K02_Rev.C09, 938-K03_Rev.C07, 938-K04_Rev.C12, 938-K05_Rev.P03, 938-K06_Rev.C09, 938-K07_Rev.C03, 938-K08_Rev.C02 & A2D-938-EW01_Rev.P03 received 06/04/2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Construction Management Plan submitted under 161487CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 12/04/2017.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.

| The hard and soft landscaping works indicated on drawing ref: A2D-938-OD01 Revision K of the planning application P/2014/4792 dated 06/01/2016 shall be fully provided prior to the occupation of the development. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (i) and 1.2 (d) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | Refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on drawing reference A2D-938-EW01_Rev.P03 shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the insulation of the building envelope submitted under 163839CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 22/09/2016.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the scheme for providing fresh air ventilation to habitable rooms facing Uxbridge Road submitted under 162563CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 27/07/2016. The approved mitigation scheme shall be implemented in its entirety before any of the units are occupied and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The design of the building shall comply with the aims and objectives of the Secured By Design standards before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the development incorporates crime prevention measures to help prevent crime and disorder and to improve pedestrian accessibility in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy LV 7.3 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.3 of the London Plan (2015).
| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Construction Management Plan submitted under 161487CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 12/04/2017.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan 2015 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.
| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Piling Method Statement submitted under 171268CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 15/05/2017.

Reason: The proposed works would be in close proximity to underground water and sewerage utility infrastructure in accordance with policy 5.13 of the London Plan 2015 and policies (e) and (k) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| Cycle parking indicated on drawing reference A2D-938-EW01_Rev.P03 shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2015.

| The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan reference A2D-938-EW01_Rev.P03 shall be laid out prior to first occupation of any of the unit hereby permitted and permanently retained without obstruction.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2015). | Prior to the first occupation, the approved scheme including both Blocks One and Two, shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve a reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 35.65% beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings according to Energy Statement (16 February 2017) prepared by Element Sustainability and other supporting documentation (dated 11, 24-25 May 2017):
o         energy saving measures to achieve at least a percentage of 10.7% (equal to 1.37 tonnes CO2/yr) in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the compliant Part L 2013 base case

o         incorporation of on-site renewable energy generation to achieve at least a percentage of 27.91% (equal to 3.18 tonnes CO2/yr) in carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Lean base case.

Within 3 months of first occupation of the new dwellings, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's] and modelling output reports from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures should be also submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.
The development shall be constructed in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such thereafter.

Reason: To secure the measures set out within the approved Energy Statement and Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment and to ensure that the energy efficiency measures to be incorporated into the approved development contribute to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2011 (with REMA 2013), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Details of the layout and array of photovoltaic panels, which shall provide for no less than 7.8kWp (equivalent to 3.18 tonnes CO2 emission savings/annum or 27.91% on-site C02 reduction against the 'Be Lean' stage in total for both Blocks One and Two) as detailed within the approved Energy Statement (16 February 2017) prepared by Element Sustainability and other supporting documentation (dated 11, 24-25 May 2017), shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works of the approved development.

Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and combating climate change in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3 and 5.7 of the London Plan 2011 (with REMA 2013); policy 1.1(k) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy LV 5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Prior to the first occupation of all dwellings, the approved scheme shall incorporate and maintain measures as stated in the approved Sustainability Statement prepared by Silver Energy Management Solutions Limited in 10 April 2015.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2015, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Site Contamination Report submitted under 165503CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 21/12/2016.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework.
| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Contaminated Land Remediation Strategy submitted under 172962CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 23/06/2017.

Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan, policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework.
| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Obscure Glazing submitted under 170110CND approved by the Local Planning Authority on 06/03/2017.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policy 1.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5 & 7.15 of The London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
